40 #include <algorithm>
41 #include "StringUtils.hpp"

54 
55  void reallyPutRecordVer2( Rinex3ObsStream& strm,
56  const Rinex3ObsData& rod )
57  throw(FFStreamError, StringException)
58  {
59 
60  // is there anything to write?
61  if( (rod.epochFlag==0 || rod.epochFlag==1 || rod.epochFlag==6)
62  && (rod.numSVs==0 || rod.obs.empty()) ) return;
63 
64  if( rod.epochFlag>=2
65  && rod.epochFlag<=5
66  && rod.auxHeader.NumberHeaderRecordsToBeWritten()==0 ) return;
67 
68  // first the epoch line to 'line'
69  //line = writeTime(rod.time); // (ver 2 RinexObsData::writeTime)
70  string line;
71  if(rod.time == CommonTime::BEGINNING_OF_TIME)
72  line = string(26, ' ');
73  else
74  {
75  CivilTime civTime(rod.time);
76  line = string(1, ' ');
77  line += rightJustify(asString<short>(civTime.year),2);
78  line += string(1, ' ');
79  line += rightJustify(asString<short>(civTime.month),2);
80  line += string(1, ' ');
81  line += rightJustify(asString<short>(civTime.day),2);
82  line += string(1, ' ');
83  line += rightJustify(asString<short>(civTime.hour),2);
84  line += string(1, ' ');
85  line += rightJustify(asString<short>(civTime.minute),2);
86  line += rightJustify(asString(civTime.second, 7),11);
87  line += string(2, ' ');
88  line += rightJustify(asString<short>(rod.epochFlag), 1);
89  line += rightJustify(asString<short>(rod.numSVs), 3);
90  }
91 
92  // write satellite ids to 'line'
93  const int maxPrnsPerLine = 12;
94  int satsWritten = 0;
95 
96  Rinex3ObsData::DataMap::const_iterator itr(rod.obs.begin());
97 
98  if( rod.epochFlag==0 || rod.epochFlag==1 || rod.epochFlag==6 )
99  {
100  while( itr != rod.obs.end() && satsWritten < maxPrnsPerLine )
101  {
102  line += itr->first.toString();
103  satsWritten++;
104  itr++;
105  }
106 
107  // add clock offset
108  if( rod.clockOffset != 0.0 )
109  {
110  line += string(68 - line.size(), ' ');
111  line += rightJustify( asString(rod.clockOffset, 9), 12 );
112  }
113 
114  // continuation lines
115  while( satsWritten != rod.obs.size() )
116  {
117  if((satsWritten % maxPrnsPerLine) == 0)
118  {
119  strm << line << endl;
120  strm.lineNumber++;
121  line = string(32, ' ');
122  }
123  line += itr->first.toString();
124  satsWritten++;
125  itr++;
126  }
127 
128  } // End of 'if( rod.epochFlag==0 || rod.epochFlag==1 || ...'
129 
130  // write the epoch line
131  strm << line << endl;
132  strm.lineNumber++;
133 
134  // write the auxiliary header records, if any
135  if( rod.epochFlag >= 2 && rod.epochFlag <= 5 )
136  {
137  try
138  {
139  rod.auxHeader.WriteHeaderRecords(strm);
140  }
141  catch(FFStreamError& e)
142  {
143  GPSTK_RETHROW(e);
144  }
145  catch(StringException& e)
146  {
147  GPSTK_RETHROW(e);
148  }
149  } // write out data
150  else if( rod.epochFlag == 0 || rod.epochFlag == 1 || rod.epochFlag == 6 )
151  {
152  size_t i;
153  const int maxObsPerLine(5);
154 
155  // loop over satellites in R3 obs data
156  for( itr = rod.obs.begin(); itr != rod.obs.end(); ++itr )
157  {
158 
159  RinexSatID sat(itr->first); // current satellite
160  string sys(string(1,sat.systemChar())); // system
161  itr = rod.obs.find(sat); // get data vector to be written
162  int obsWritten(0);
163  line = string("");
164 
165  // loop over R2 obstypes
166  for( i=0; i<strm.header.R2ObsTypes.size(); i++ )
167  {
168 
169  // get the R3 obs ID from the map
170  RinexObsID obsid;
171  obsid =
172  strm.header.mapSysR2toR3ObsID[sys][strm.header.R2ObsTypes[i]];
173 
174  // now find index of that data from R3 header
175  const vector<RinexObsID>& vecData(strm.header.mapObsTypes[sys]);
176 
177  vector<RinexObsID>::const_iterator jt;
178  jt = find(vecData.begin(), vecData.end(), obsid);
179 
180  int ind(-1); // index into vecData
181 
182  if( jt != vecData.end() ) ind = jt-vecData.begin();
183 
184  // need a continuation line?
185  if( obsWritten != 0 && (obsWritten % maxObsPerLine) == 0 )
186  {
187  strm << line << endl;
188  strm.lineNumber++;
189  line = string("");
190  }
191 
192  // write the line
193  line += rightJustify(asString( // double 14.3
194  ( ind == -1 ? 0.0 : itr->second[ind].data),3),14 );
195  line += (ind == -1 || itr->second[ind].lli == 0)
196  ? string(1, ' ')
197  : rightJustify(asString<short>(itr->second[ind].lli),1);
198  line += (ind == -1 || itr->second[ind].ssi == 0)
199  ? string(1, ' ')
200  : rightJustify(asString<short>(itr->second[ind].ssi),1);
201  obsWritten++;
202 
203  } // End of 'for( i=0; i<strm.header.R2ObsTypes.size(); i++ )'
204 
205  strm << line << endl;
206  strm.lineNumber++;
207 
208  } // End of 'for( itr = rod.obs.begin(); itr != rod.obs.end();...'
209 
210  } // Ebf of 'else if( rod.epochFlag == 0 || rod.epochFlag == 1 || ...'
211 
212  } // End of function 'reallyPutRecordVer2()'
213 
214 
215  /* This method returns the RinexDatum of a given observation
216  *
217  * @param sat Satellite whose observation we want to fetch.
218  * @param index Index representing the observation type. It is
219  * obtained from corresponding RINEX Observation Header
220  * using method 'Rinex3ObsHeader::getObsIndex()'.
221  */
222  RinexDatum Rinex3ObsData::getObs( const SatID& sat, int index ) const
223  throw(InvalidRequest)
224  {
225 
226  RinexSatID rsat(sat);
227 
228  // Look for the satellite in 'DataMap'
229  Rinex3ObsData::DataMap::const_iterator it;
230  it = obs.find(rsat);
231 
232  // Check if satellite was found
233  if( it == obs.end() )
234  {
235  InvalidRequest ir( rsat.toString() + " is not available.");
236  GPSTK_THROW(ir);
237  }
238 
239  // Extract a copy of the data vector
240  vector<RinexDatum> vecData(it->second);
241 
242  // Return the corresponding data
243  return vecData[index];
244 
245  } // End of method 'Rinex3ObsData::getObs()'
246 
247 
248  /* This method returns the RinexDatum of a given observation
249  *
250  * @param sat Satellite whose observation we want to fetch.
251  * @param type String representing the observation type.
252  * @param hdr RINEX Observation Header for current RINEX file.
253  */
254  RinexDatum Rinex3ObsData::getObs( const SatID& sat, std::string type,
255  const Rinex3ObsHeader& hdr ) const
256  throw(InvalidRequest)
257  {
258 
259  // We will need the system 'char' of the satellite
260  RinexSatID rsat(sat);
261 
262  // Add GNSS code if needed
263  if( type.size() == 3 )
264  {
265  char sysCode = rsat.systemChar();
266  type = sysCode + type;
267  }
268 
269  // Get the index corresponding to this observation type
270  int index( hdr.getObsIndex(type) );
271 
272  // Return the corresponding data
273  return getObs(sat, index);
274 
275  } // End of method 'Rinex3ObsData::getValue( const SatID sat,...'
276 
277 
278  void Rinex3ObsData::reallyPutRecord(FFStream& ffs) const
279  throw(std::exception, FFStreamError, StringException)
280  {
281  // is there anything to write?
282  if( (epochFlag == 0 || epochFlag == 1 || epochFlag == 6)
283  && (numSVs==0 || obs.empty())) return;
284 // if( (epochFlag >= 2 && epochFlag <= 5) &&
285 // auxHeader.NumberHeaderRecordsToBeWritten() == 0 ) return;
286 
287  Rinex3ObsStream& strm = dynamic_cast<Rinex3ObsStream&>(ffs);
288 
289  // call the version for RINEX ver 2
290  if(strm.header.version < 3) {
291  try {
292  reallyPutRecordVer2(strm, *this);
293  }
294  catch(Exception& e) { GPSTK_RETHROW(e); }
295  return;
296  }
297 
298  string line;
299 
300  // first the epoch line
301  line = ">";
302  line += writeTime(time);
303  line += string(2, ' ');
304  line += rightJustify(asString<short>(epochFlag), 1);
305  line += rightJustify(asString<short>(numSVs ), 3);
306  line += string(6, ' ');
307  if(clockOffset != 0.0) // optional data; need to test for its existence
308  line += rightJustify(asString(clockOffset, 12), 15);
309 
310  strm << line << endl;
311  strm.lineNumber++;
312  line.erase();
313 
314  if(epochFlag == 0 || epochFlag == 1 || epochFlag == 6) {
315  DataMap::const_iterator itr = obs.begin();
316 
317  while(itr != obs.end()) {
318  line = itr->first.toString();
319 
320  for(size_t i=0; i < itr->second.size(); i++) {
321  RinexDatum thisData = itr->second[i];
322  line += rightJustify(asString(thisData.data,3),14);
323 
324  if(thisData.lli == 0)
325  line += string(1, ' ');
326  else
327  line += rightJustify(asString<short>(thisData.lli),1);
328 
329  if(thisData.ssi == 0)
330  line += string(1, ' ');
331  else
332  line += rightJustify(asString<short>(thisData.ssi),1);
333  }
334  // write the data line out
335  strm << line << endl;
336  strm.lineNumber++;
337  line.erase();
338 
339  itr++;
340  } // end loop over sats and data
341  }
342 
343  // write the auxiliary header records, if any
344  else if(epochFlag >= 2 && epochFlag <= 5) {
345  try {
346  auxHeader.WriteHeaderRecords(strm);
347  }
348  catch(FFStreamError& e) { GPSTK_RETHROW(e); }
349  catch(StringException& e) { GPSTK_RETHROW(e); }
350  }
351 
352  } // end Rinex3ObsData::reallyPutRecord
353 
354  void reallyGetRecordVer2(Rinex3ObsStream& strm, Rinex3ObsData& rod)
355  throw(Exception)
356  {
357  static CommonTime previousTime(CommonTime::BEGINNING_OF_TIME);
358 
359  // get the epoch line and check
360  string line;
361  while(line.empty()) // ignore blank lines in place of epoch lines
362  strm.formattedGetLine(line, true);
363 
364  if(line.size()>80 || line[0] != ' ' || line[3] != ' ' || line[6] != ' ') {
365  FFStreamError e("Bad epoch line: >" + line + "<");
366  GPSTK_THROW(e);
367  }
368 
369  // process the epoch line, including SV list and clock bias
370  rod.epochFlag = asInt(line.substr(28,1));
371  if((rod.epochFlag < 0) || (rod.epochFlag > 6)) {
372  FFStreamError e("Invalid epoch flag: " + asString(rod.epochFlag));
373  GPSTK_THROW(e);
374  }
375 
376  // Not all epoch flags are required to have a time.
377  // Specifically, 0,1,5,6 must have an epoch time; it is optional for 2,3,4.
378  // If there is and epoch time, parse it and load it in the member "time".
379  // If epoch flag=0, 1, 5, or 6 and there is NO epoch time, then throw.
380  // If epoch flag=2, 3, or 4 and there is no epoch time,
381  // use the time of the previous record.
382  bool noEpochTime = (line.substr(0,26) == string(26, ' '));
383  if(noEpochTime && (rod.epochFlag==0 || rod.epochFlag==1 ||
384  rod.epochFlag==5 || rod.epochFlag==6 )) {
385  FFStreamError e("Required epoch time missing: " + line);
386  GPSTK_THROW(e);
387  }
388  else if(noEpochTime)
389  rod.time = previousTime;
390  else {
391  try {
392  // check if the spaces are in the right place - an easy
393  // way to check if there's corruption in the file
394  if((line[0] != ' ') || (line[3] != ' ') || (line[6] != ' ') ||
395  (line[9] != ' ') || (line[12] != ' ') || (line[15] != ' '))
396  {
397  FFStreamError e("Invalid time format");
398  GPSTK_THROW(e);
399  }
400 
401  // if there's no time, just use a bad time
402  if(line.substr(0,26) == string(26, ' '))
403  rod.time = CommonTime::BEGINNING_OF_TIME;
404  //rod.time = previousTime; ??
405  else {
406  int year, month, day, hour, min;
407  double sec;
408  int yy = (static_cast<CivilTime>(strm.header.firstObs)).year/100;
409  yy *= 100;
410 
411  year = asInt( line.substr(1, 2 ));
412  month = asInt( line.substr(4, 2 ));
413  day = asInt( line.substr(7, 2 ));
414  hour = asInt( line.substr(10, 2 ));
415  min = asInt( line.substr(13, 2 ));
416  sec = asDouble(line.substr(15, 11));
417 
418  // Real Rinex has epochs 'yy mm dd hr 59 60.0' surprisingly often....
419  double ds(0);
420  if(sec >= 60.) { ds=sec; sec=0.0; }
421  CivilTime rv(yy+year, month, day, hour, min, sec, TimeSystem::GPS);
422  if(ds != 0) rv.second += ds;
423 
424  rod.time = rv.convertToCommonTime();
425  }
426  }
427  // string exceptions for substr are caught here
428  catch(exception &e)
429  {
430  FFStreamError err("std::exception: " + string(e.what()));
431  GPSTK_THROW(err);
432  }
433  catch(Exception& e)
434  {
435  string text;
436  for(size_t i=0; i<e.getTextCount(); i++) text += e.getText(i);
437  FFStreamError err("gpstk::Exception in parseTime(): " + text);
438  GPSTK_THROW(err);
439  }
440  // end rod.time = parseTime(line, strm.header);
441 
442  // save for next call
443  previousTime = rod.time;
444  }
445 
446  // number of satellites
447  rod.numSVs = asInt(line.substr(29,3));
448 
449  // clock offset
450  if(line.size() > 68 )
451  rod.clockOffset = asDouble(line.substr(68, 12));
452  else
453  rod.clockOffset = 0.0;
454 
455  // Read the observations ...
456  if(rod.epochFlag==0 || rod.epochFlag==1 || rod.epochFlag==6) {
457  // first read the SatIDs off the epoch line
458  int isv, ndx, line_ndx;
459  string satsys;
460  RinexSatID sat;
461  vector<RinexSatID> satIndex(rod.numSVs);
462  for(isv=1, ndx=0; ndx<rod.numSVs; isv++, ndx++) {
463  if(!(isv % 13)) { // get a new continuation line
464  strm.formattedGetLine(line);
465  isv = 1;
466  if(line.size() > 80) {
467  FFStreamError err("Invalid line size:" + asString(line.size()));
468  GPSTK_THROW(err);
469  }
470  }
471 
472  // read the sat id
473  try {
474  sat = RinexSatID(line.substr(30+isv*3-1, 3));
475  satIndex[ndx] = sat;
477  //string satsys = asString(sat.systemChar());
478  //if(strm.header.mapObsTypes[satsys].size() == 0) {
479  // strm.header.mapObsTypes[satsys] = strm.header.mapObsTypes["G"];
480  //}
481  }
482  catch (Exception& e) {
483  FFStreamError ffse(e);
484  GPSTK_THROW(ffse);
485  }
486  } // end loop over numSVs
487 
488  // loop over all sats, reading obs data
489  int numObs(strm.header.R2ObsTypes.size());// number of R2 OTs in header
490  rod.obs.clear();
491  for(isv=0; isv < rod.numSVs; isv++) {
492  //strm.formattedGetLine(line); // get a line
493  //line.resize(80, ' '); // pad just in case
494  sat = satIndex[isv]; // sat for this data
495  satsys = asString(sat.systemChar()); // system for this sat
496  vector<RinexDatum> data;
497  // loop over data in the line
498  for(ndx=0, line_ndx=0; ndx < numObs; ndx++, line_ndx++) {
499  if(! (line_ndx % 5)) { // get a new line
500  strm.formattedGetLine(line);
501  line.resize(80, ' '); // pad just in case
502  line_ndx = 0;
503  if(line.size() > 80) {
504  FFStreamError err("Invalid line size:" + asString(line.size()));
505  GPSTK_THROW(err);
506  }
507  }
508 
509  // does this R2 OT map into a valid R3 ObsID?
510  string R2ot(strm.header.R2ObsTypes[ndx]);
511  string R3ot(strm.header.mapSysR2toR3ObsID[satsys][R2ot].asString());
512  if(R3ot != string(" ")) {
513  RinexDatum tempData;
514  tempData.data = asDouble(line.substr(line_ndx*16, 14));
515  tempData.lli = asInt(line.substr(line_ndx*16+14, 1));
516  tempData.ssi = asInt(line.substr(line_ndx*16+15, 1));
517  data.push_back(tempData);
518  }
519  }
520  rod.obs[sat] = data;
521 
522  } // end loop over sats to read obs data
523  }
524 
525  // ... or the auxiliary header information
526  else if(rod.numSVs > 0) {
527  rod.auxHeader.clear();
528  for(int i=0; i<rod.numSVs; i++)
529  {
530  strm.formattedGetLine(line);
531  StringUtils::stripTrailing(line);
532  try {
533  rod.auxHeader.ParseHeaderRecord(line);
534  }
535  catch(FFStreamError& e) { GPSTK_RETHROW(e); }
536  catch(StringException& e) { GPSTK_RETHROW(e); }
537  }
538  }
539  } // end void reallyGetRecordVer2(Rinex3ObsStream& strm, Rinex3ObsData& rod)
540 
541 
542  void Rinex3ObsData::reallyGetRecord(FFStream& ffs)
543  throw(exception, FFStreamError, gpstk::StringUtils::StringException)
544  {
545  Rinex3ObsStream& strm = dynamic_cast<Rinex3ObsStream&>(ffs);
546 
547  // If the header hasn't been read, read it.
548  if(!strm.headerRead) strm >> strm.header;
549 
550  // call the version for RINEX ver 2
551  if(strm.header.version < 3) {
552  try {
553  reallyGetRecordVer2(strm, *this);
554  }
555  catch(Exception& e) { GPSTK_RETHROW(e); }
556  return;
557  }
558 
559  string line;
560  Rinex3ObsData rod;
561 
562  // clear out this ObsData
563  *this = rod;
564 
565  // read the first (epoch) line
566  strm.formattedGetLine(line, true);
567 
568  // Check and parse the epoch line -----------------------------------
569  // Check for epoch marker ('>') and following space.
570  if(line[0] != '>' || line[1] != ' ') {
571  FFStreamError e("Bad epoch line: >" + line + "<");
572  GPSTK_THROW(e);
573  }
574 
575  epochFlag = asInt(line.substr(31,1));
576  if(epochFlag < 0 || epochFlag > 6) {
577  FFStreamError e("Invalid epoch flag: " + asString(epochFlag));
578  GPSTK_THROW(e);
579  }
580 
581  time = parseTime(line, strm.header, strm.timesystem);
582 
583  numSVs = asInt(line.substr(32,3));
584 
585  if(line.size() > 41)
586  clockOffset = asDouble(line.substr(41,15));
587  else
588  clockOffset = 0.0;
589 
590  // Read the observations: SV ID and data ----------------------------
591  if(epochFlag == 0 || epochFlag == 1 || epochFlag == 6) {
592  vector<RinexSatID> satIndex(numSVs);
593  map<RinexSatID, vector<RinexDatum> > tempDataMap;
594 
595  for(int isv = 0; isv < numSVs; isv++) {
596  strm.formattedGetLine(line);
597 
598  // get the SV ID
599  try {
600  satIndex[isv] = RinexSatID(line.substr(0,3));
601  }
602  catch (Exception& e) {
603  FFStreamError ffse(e);
604  GPSTK_THROW(ffse);
605  }
606 
607  // get the # data items (# entries in ObsType map of maps from header)
608  string gnss = asString(satIndex[isv].systemChar());
609  int size = strm.header.mapObsTypes[gnss].size();
610 
611  // Some receivers leave blanks for missing Obs (which is OK by RINEX 3).
612  // If the last Obs are the ones missing, it won't necessarily be padded
613  // with spaces, so the parser will break. This adds the padding to let
614  // the parser do its job and interpret spaces as zeroes.
615  size_t minSize = 3 + 16*size;
616  if(line.size() < minSize)
617  line += string(minSize-line.size(), ' ');
618 
619  // get the data (# entries in ObsType map of maps from header)
620  vector<RinexDatum> data;
621  for(int i = 0; i < size; i++) {
622  size_t pos = 3 + 16*i;
623  RinexDatum tempData;
624  tempData.data = asDouble(line.substr(pos , 14));
625  if( line.size() > pos+14 )
626  tempData.lli = asInt( line.substr(pos+14, 1));
627  if( line.size() > pos+15 )
628  tempData.ssi = asInt( line.substr(pos+15, 1));
629  data.push_back(tempData);
630  }
631  obs[satIndex[isv]] = data;
632  }
633  }
634 
635  // ... or the auxiliary header information
636  else if(numSVs > 0) {
637  auxHeader.clear();
638  for(int i = 0; i < numSVs; i++) {
639  strm.formattedGetLine(line);
640  StringUtils::stripTrailing(line);
641  try {
642  auxHeader.ParseHeaderRecord(line);
643  }
644  catch(FFStreamError& e) { GPSTK_RETHROW(e); }
645  catch(StringException& e) { GPSTK_RETHROW(e); }
646  }
647  }
648 
649  return;
650 
651  } // end of reallyGetRecord()
652 
653 
654  CommonTime Rinex3ObsData::parseTime(const string& line,
655  const Rinex3ObsHeader& hdr,
656  const TimeSystem& ts) const
657  throw(FFStreamError)
658  {
659  try {
660  // check if the spaces are in the right place - an easy
661  // way to check if there's corruption in the file
662  if( (line[ 1] != ' ') || (line[ 6] != ' ') || (line[ 9] != ' ') ||
663  (line[12] != ' ') || (line[15] != ' ') || (line[18] != ' ') ||
664  (line[29] != ' ') || (line[30] != ' '))
665  {
666  FFStreamError e("Invalid time format");
667  GPSTK_THROW(e);
668  }
669 
670  // if there's no time, just return a bad time
671  if(line.substr(2,27) == string(27, ' '))
672  return CommonTime::BEGINNING_OF_TIME;
673 
674  int year, month, day, hour, min;
675  double sec;
676 
677  year = asInt( line.substr( 2, 4));
678  month = asInt( line.substr( 7, 2));
679  day = asInt( line.substr(10, 2));
680  hour = asInt( line.substr(13, 2));
681  min = asInt( line.substr(16, 2));
682  sec = asDouble(line.substr(19, 11));
683 
684  // Real Rinex has epochs 'yy mm dd hr 59 60.0' surprisingly often.
685  double ds = 0;
686  if(sec >= 60.) { ds = sec; sec = 0.0; }
687 
688  CommonTime rv = CivilTime(year,month,day,hour,min,sec).convertToCommonTime();
689  if(ds != 0) rv += ds;
690 
691  rv.setTimeSystem(ts);
692 
693  return rv;
694  }
695  // string exceptions for substr are caught here
696  catch (std::exception &e) {
697  FFStreamError err("std::exception: " + string(e.what()));
698  GPSTK_THROW(err);
699  }
700  catch (gpstk::Exception& e) {
701  string text;
702  for(size_t i=0; i<e.getTextCount(); i++) text += e.getText(i);
703  FFStreamError err("gpstk::Exception in parseTime(): " + text);
704  GPSTK_THROW(err);
705  }
706  } // end parseTime
707 
708  string Rinex3ObsData::writeTime(const CommonTime& ct) const
709  throw(StringException)
710  {
711  if(ct == CommonTime::BEGINNING_OF_TIME)
712  return string(26, ' ');
713 
714  CivilTime civtime(ct);
715  string line;
716 
717  line = string(1, ' ');
718  line += rightJustify(asString<short>(civtime.year ), 4);
719  line += string(1, ' ');
720  line += rightJustify(asString<short>(civtime.month ), 2, '0');
721  line += string(1, ' ');
722  line += rightJustify(asString<short>(civtime.day ), 2, '0');
723  line += string(1, ' ');
724  line += rightJustify(asString<short>(civtime.hour ), 2, '0');
725  line += string(1, ' ');
726  line += rightJustify(asString<short>(civtime.minute ), 2, '0');
727  line += rightJustify(asString (civtime.second,7),11);
728 
729  return line;
730  } // end writeTime
731 
732 
733  void Rinex3ObsData::dump(ostream& s) const
734  {
735  if(obs.empty())
736  return;
737 
738  s << "Dump of Rinex3ObsData" << endl << " - time: " << writeTime(time)
739  << " epochFlag: " << " " << epochFlag
740  << " numSVs: " << numSVs
741  << fixed << setprecision(9) << " clk offset: " << clockOffset << endl;
742 
743  if(epochFlag == 0 || epochFlag == 1) {
744  DataMap::const_iterator jt;
745  for(jt = obs.begin(); jt != obs.end(); jt++) {
746  s << " " << (jt->first).toString() << ":" << fixed << setprecision(3);
747  for(size_t i = 0; i < jt->second.size(); i++)
748  {
749  s << " " << setw(12) << jt->second[i].data
750  << "/" << jt->second[i].lli << "/" << jt->second[i].ssi;
751  }
752  s << endl;
753  }
754  }
755  else {
756  s << "aux. header info:\n";
757  auxHeader.dump(s);
758  }
759  } // end dump
760 
761 
762  void Rinex3ObsData::dump(ostream& os, Rinex3ObsHeader& head) const
763  {
764  os << "Dump of Rinex3ObsData: "
765  << printTime(time,"%4F/%w/%10.3g = %04Y/%02m/%02d %02H:%02M:%02S")
766  << " flag " << epochFlag << " NSVs " << numSVs
767  << fixed << setprecision(6) << " clk " << clockOffset;
768 
769  if(obs.empty()) { os << " : EMPTY" << endl; return; }
770  else os << endl;
771 
772  if(epochFlag >= 2) {
773  os << "Auxiliary header:\n";
774  auxHeader.dump(os);
775  return;
776  }
777 
778  for(DataMap::const_iterator jt=obs.begin(); jt != obs.end(); jt++) {
779  RinexSatID sat(jt->first);
780  const vector<RinexObsID> types(head.mapObsTypes[sat.toString().substr(0,1)]);
781  os << " " << sat.toString() << fixed << setprecision(3);
782  for(size_t i=0; i<jt->second.size(); i++)
783  os << " " << setw(13) << jt->second[i].data
784  << "/" << jt->second[i].lli
785  << "/" << jt->second[i].ssi
786  << "/" << types[i].asString()
787  ;
788  os << endl;
789  }
790 
791  }
792 
793 } // namespace
